Yixiong ChangLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 08 Nov 2018I believe if your next month balance increases by $500, you'll be eligible for additional rate of 0.3-0.6%. Cos your salary would be credited into the account, I believe u should be able to grow the balance? Another interesting account to look at: I can explain more if u do not understand.https://www.citibank.com.sg/gcb/deposits/mxgn-savacc.htmCurrent tranche of SSB will get u about 2.57% if u held it for 10years. No point going for FD. ETF will be a totally different risk level, and it will require more detailed/separate breakdown analysis.   What do u need/plan to do with the money at the end of 10-15years?Do u intend to plan for retirement? Have u ever considered topping up CPF special account?You will earned a guaranteed rate of 4%. For the first $60k in your CPF combined balance (with only up to $20k max from OA), the monies will earn an extra 1%. You might not have passed the limit yet. Thus it is worthwhile to topup to earn effective 5% return. Risk-free, regardless of market conditions.In additional u will receive tax relief for the topped up amount. Eg, your taxable income is $40k, for every dollar u earn above 40k is taxed at 7%. Therefore, if u topped up $1000 into your special account, u get $1000 tax relief, u saved 7% of $1000 = $70 tax money. Effectively have gotten 7% return on your money, in additional u will earn 4%% interest yearly guaranteed.Also, have you already covered yourself with appropriate insurance. I advocate buying direct insurance (buy direct with insurer without the agent involved). If you have bought any life insurance or related products in the past few years, it might still be worthwhile to still compare.Are you taking on HDB loan, started in the last couple years? This is with regards to the HPS insurance. 0 comments0
